sim module¶

The sim module provides the interface of the simulation sim. In the simulation sim all the data of the particles, tiles, and locations are stored. It also have the the coordination system and stated the maximum of the x and y coordinate.

class sim.sim(size_x=0, size_y=0, sim_name=None, sim=None, max_particles=50, mm_limitation=False, particle_mm_size=0, tile_mm_size=0, location_mm_size=0)[source]¶

Bases: object

add_location(x, y, color=1, alpha=1)[source]¶

Add a tile to the sim database

Parameters:
  • color –
  • x – the x coordinates on which the tile should be added
  • y – the y coordinates on which the tile should be added
Returns:

True: Successful added; False: Unsuccsessful
add_particle(x, y, color=1, alpha=1)[source]¶

Add a particle to the sim database

Parameters:
  • x – The x coordinate of the particle
  • y – The y coordinate of the particle
  • state – The state of the particle. Default: S for for Stopped or Not Moving. Other options are the moving directions: E, SE, SW, W, NW, NE
  • color – The color of the particle. Coloroptions: black, gray, red, green, or blue
Returns:

True: Successful added; False: Unsuccsessful

Adds a tile to the sims database

Parameters:

  • x – the x coordinates on which the tile should be added
  • y – the y coordinates on which the tile should be added
Returns:

True: Successful added; False: Unsuccsessful

check_coords(coords_x, coords_y)[source]¶

Checks if the given coordinates are matching the hexagon coordinates

Parameters:
  • coords_x – proposed x coordinate
  • coords_y – proposed y coordinate
Returns:

True: Correct x and y coordinates; False: Incorrect coordinates
get_coords_in_dir(coords, dir)[source]¶

Returns the coordination data of the pointed directions

Parameters:
  • coords – particles actual staying coordination
  • dir – The direction. Options: E, SE, SW, W, NW, or NE
Returns:

The coordinaiton of the pointed directions

Parameters:id – The locations id that should be removec
Returns:True: Successful removed; False: Unsuccessful
